content: faggoting every 4 row so that the first lace section continues up the side of the thumb as follows 1st increase row 1 m1l yo ssk m1r knit 5 continue in pattern to end of row increase 2 stitches row 2 & 4 k1 k2tog yo k6 continue in pattern to end of row row 3 k1 yo ssk k6 continue in pattern to end of row 2nd increase row 1 m1l k1 yo ssk k1 m1r knit 5 continue in pattern to end of row increase 2 stitches row 2 & 4 k2 k2tog yo k7 continue in pattern to end of row row 3 k2 yo ssk k7 continue in pattern to end of row continue in this way knitting the additional stitches on either side of the lace section until you have completed 8 9 increase row 65 74 stitches in all ending at the end of row 1 place the next 18 20 stitches on a length of spare yarn cast-on 2 stitches then continue with the round in pattern back to 49 56 stitches next row knit 7 stitches continue in pattern following row k2tog yo knit 5 continue in pattern hand continue in pattern on these 49 56 stitches until the top section of hand has reached the desired length ending with an ssk row i knitted a further 18 row until the glove measured 8½ including the picot edge next row k2tog knit 5 decrease 7 8 stitches the reduction in stitches prevents the upper edge from flaring out and ensures a snug fit but this row can be omitted if you prefer upper edge knit 5 rounds stocking stitch then 1 round of yo k2 decrease to form the picot edge then a further 5 rounds stocking stitch cast off very loosely i used a sewn bind-off for elasticity thumb pick up and knit the 18 20 stitches left on spare yarn including a k2tog yo when you reach the lace section pick up a further three stitches from the cast-on edge to complete the round 21 23 stitches in all work 5 more row in pattern on the final row omit the yo in the lace section decrease 1 stitch to 20 22 stitches knit 4 rounds stocking stitch then 1 round of yo k2 decrease to form the picot edge then a further 4 rounds stocking stitch cast off very loosely 2 finishing sew the upper edges of the hand and thumb to the inside and weave in all ends knit second glove stitches used m1l place the left needle from back to front under the strand of yarn between the stitch you have knitted and the next one forming a new stitch knit into the front of this new stitch m1r place the left needle from front to back under the strand of yarn between the stitch you have knitted and the next one forming a new stitch knit into the back of this new stitch sara varty january
